channel.title: Posts on Pwn October: A blog on Coding, Devops, Information Security and CTFs.
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Pwn October: A blog on Coding, Devops, Information Security and CTFs.

item.title: Codefest CTF 2017 - RoleReversal - Steganography
item.description: Ms. Airwrecka is carrying out research on how to hide her cough questionable cough things.

item.title: Codefest CTF 2017 - SimplyBlack - Steganography
item.description: Black is not the only black. There are 50 shades of grey.

item.title: Codefest CTF 2017 - Digging Deeper - Steganography
item.description: Jaime is digging Cersie’s grave because he hates her, and he needs to go DEEEP.

item.title: STEM CTF: Cyber Challenge 2017 - Trust Issues - Web - 50 points
item.description: I’d like to file a complaint about your website

item.title: HITB CTF - Simple Transfer - Misc
item.description: The file contains a flag, find it.

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Substitute Teacher - Cryptography
item.description: Hello, my name is Mr. Smith, I will be your substitute teacher for today. I only have one assignment for you today, if you solve it you may go home.

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Rotation - Cryptography
item.description: Seems someone rotated the alphabet, can you get the original message back?

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Transposition - Cryptography
item.description: We intercepted this secret message. We believe it is using a transposition cipher. Can you decipher it?

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Location - Web
item.description: Like in real estate, the web is all about location, location and location.

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Deleted File - Forensics
item.description: There is a flag hidden in this binary. Can you find it?

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Captured Mail - Pcap
item.description: We intercepted this mail message. Can you open the attachment?

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Hidden Message - Binary
item.description: This file contains a hidden message. Can you reverse engineer it and find it?

item.title: SHA2017 - Junior CTF - Weird Website - Pcap
item.description: We captured some traffic while visiting this website. Can you get some information from it?

item.description: We received another zip file, which also requires a password

item.description: Seems we have a broken image on our website

item.description: We found this Old School Website.

item.description: There is a flag hidden in this binary. Can you find it?

item.description: We found this encoded message. Can you decode it?

item.description: Sometimes you have just to listen to your head.

item.title: WhiteHat Challenge 03 - Web001 - Web
item.description: Sign in and get the flag in the following site.

item.title: WhiteHat Challenge 03 - For002 - Forensics
item.description: We have eavesdropped a piece of network data when a user signed in a website. Find the flag as his password.

item.title: 2017 05 08 Whitehat Challenge 03 For001 Forensics
item.description: This piece of data is captured via USB port, look for the flag transferred through it.

item.title: WhiteHat Challenge 03 - Crypto002 - Cryptography
item.description: We have components of an RSA cryptosystem. Decrypt the cipher to get the flag

item.title: WhiteHat Challenge 03 - Crypto001 - Cryptography
item.description: I happen to get this text, but it seems to be encrypted. Decrypt it and find the hidden flag.

item.title: YubitSec CTF - Lectures? - Forensic
item.description: I tried to log in lectures.yasar.edu.tr but I forgot my id.. But I have this file I think it has my id in it. Can you help me?

item.title: INS'HACK - Easy HTML - WEB 25
item.description: You go at your friend house. He shows you what kind of wonderful and beautiful set-up - to control his house - he has. Of course, the control panel is protected.

item.title: Title: Sunshine CTF - Easy 2
item.description: Plan ahead. Heighten your situational awareness. Dress in clothes that are common to the area where you are, or where you plan to go.

item.title: Sunshine CTF - Easy 1
item.description: Doom is upon us. We are surrounded by enemies on all sides. There is only one hope. Use your hacking skills to find it.

item.title: Pragyan CTF - Interstellar
item.description: Dr. Cooper, on another one of his endless journeys encounter a mysterious planet. However when he tried to land on it, the ship gave way and he was left stranded on the planet.

item.title: Pragyan CTF - Look Harder
item.description: There are rumours that in the Great Sahara Desert, a great treasure has been buried deep inside the ground, but the map for the exact location of the treasure over the years, has not been preserved properly.

item.title: Pragyan CTF - Lost Friends
item.description: Moana and her friends were out on a sea voyage, spending their summer joyously. Unfortnately, they came across Charybdis, the sea monster. Charybdis, furious over having unknown visitors, wreaked havoc on their ship. The ship was lost.

item.description: This one is easy.

item.title: BSIDESSF CTF: Zumbo 1
item.description: Welcome to ZUMBOCOM….you can do anything at ZUMBOCOM. Three flags await. Can you find them?

item.title: ASIS CTF Finals 2016 - CTF 101
item.description: Watch your heads!

item.title: Public Key Pinning Extension for HTTP (HPKP) on Apache Web Server
item.description: HPKP as defined in RFC7469, ‘tells a web client to associate a specific cryptographic public key with a certain web server’.

item.title: HTTP Strict Transport Security on Apache Web Server
item.description: In this exercise, the objective is to enforce HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) on an Apache web server. This is an update to the SSL/ TLS certificate deployment as documented here.

item.title: Deploying Lightweight Directory Services using OpenLDAP
item.description: In this exercise, the objective is to deploy Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) in the Samba environment initially deployed here.

item.title: Active Directory Deployment using Samba
item.description: Active Directory (AD) is a Microsoft technology that provides services within a Windows domain environment.

item.title: SSL/ TLS Certificate Deployment
item.description: SSL and its successor protocol TLS enable secure connections over an inherently insecure Internet.

item.title: LAMP Stack Deployment on CentOS
item.description: The LAMP stack; for Linux, Apache, MySQL and PHP, allows a user to run dynamic websites and web applications.

item.title: SELinux Deployment
item.description: Security Enhanced Linux (SELinux) is an implementation of mandatory access control allowing a stricter enforcement of access policies for users and applications.

item.title: Firewall Deployment on a Linux Web Server
item.description: For the second part of our web server deployment, we are required to deploy a firewall.

item.title: Web Server Deployment in Linux
item.description: As an update to this blog, I have elected to migrate to a web server that I have full control over.

item.title: SQLi to Shell - Mitigation Measures
item.description: As a follow up to this Pentester Lab exercise, there exist possible countermeasures against such an attack.

item.title: SQLi to Shell - Pentester Lab Exercise
item.description: The exercise requires us to leverage SQL injection (SQLi) to gain shell access on a vulnerable web application.

item.title: Problem 3 - Project Euler
item.description: The problem requires the largest prime factor for a given numb

item.title: Problem 2 - Project Euler
item.description: The problem requires the sum of all even-numbered Fibonacci numbers that are less than four million.

item.title: Problem 1 - Project Euler
item.description: The problem requires us to return the sum of all natural numbers below 1000; that are divisible by both 3 and 5.

item.title: Creating Bootable USB Drivers in OSX
item.description: Bootable or live operating system images are a useful tool for the systems administrator.

item.title: Digital Certificates and TLS/ SSL a Primer
item.description: Digital certificates or TLS/ SSL certificates are an implementation of public key infrastructure (PKI). In simple terms digital certificates allow a trusted third party, the certificate authority, to verify the identity of the certificate owner.

item.title: Blogging With Octopress
item.description: Octopress described as a blogging framework for hackers, is an implementation of Jekyll
